sentence.text: Storage tanks shall rest on the ground or on foundations, supports or piling made of concrete, masonry or steel.
Tank supports shall be installed on firm foundations designed to minimize uneven settling of the tank and to minimize corrosion of the part of the tank resting on the foundation.
Where the clearance below the base of the tank exceeds 300 mm, tank supports shall have a minimum fire-resistance rating of 2 h.
Every aboveground storage tank shall be supported in a manner that will prevent the allowable design stress of the tank from being exceeded.
In areas subject to earthquake forces, storage tanks, supports and connections shall be designed to resist such forces in conformance with

clause.text: Part 4 of Division B of the , and
Appendix A2 of

sentence.text: When aboveground storage tanks are located in an area that is subject to flooding, the tanks shall be securely anchored to prevent floating.

subsect.title: Normal and Emergency Venting for Aboveground Storage Tanks

sentence.text: Atmospheric and low pressure storage tanks shall be provided with normal and emergency venting in conformance with

clause.text: or
the tank design standards listed in .

sentence.text: When unstable liquids are stored, the effects of heat or gas resulting from polymerization, decomposition, condensation or self-reactivity shall be allowed for in the determination of the total venting capacity.

subsect.title: Vent Piping for Aboveground Storage Tanks

sentence.text: Except at distilleries covered in , vent piping materials and construction shall conform to
Normal vent pipe outlets for storage tanks of Class I liquids

clause.text: shall be located outside buildings not less than

subclause.text: 3.5 m above the adjacent ground level, and
1.5 m from any building opening, and

clause.text: shall discharge so that flammable vapours will not enter the building or be trapped near any part of the building.

sentence.text: Normal vent pipe outlets for storage tanks of Class II or IIIA liquids shall discharge outside buildings not less than

clause.text: 2 m above the adjacent ground level, and
1.5 m from any building opening.

sentence.text: Emergency vent outlets for storage tanks shall discharge outside buildings not less than 1.5 m from any building opening and from any combustible component of any building's exterior wall.

Except as provided in , 2 or more storage tanks are permitted to be connected to a common vent pipe for normal relief venting, provided the vent pipe size is designed to vent the combined vapours produced in the connected tanks without exceeding the allowable stresses of the tanks.

Vent piping for storage tanks for Class I liquids shall not be connected to vent piping for storage tanks for Class II or IIIA liquids, unless an effective arrangement is provided to prevent the vapours from the Class I liquids from entering the other tanks.

subsect.title: Openings Other than Vents in Aboveground Storage Tanks

sentence.text: Each connection to an aboveground storage tank through which the liquid can normally flow shall be provided with an internal or external shut-off valve located as close as practical to the shell of the tank.
Each connection to an aboveground storage tank that is below the liquid level and through which liquid does not normally flow shall be provided with a liquid-tight closing device.

Valves and their connections to a storage tank shall be made of steel, except that when the chemical characteristics of the liquid stored are incompatible with steel, materials other than steel are permitted to be used.
Materials for valves and their connections to a storage tank shall be suitable for the pressures, stresses and temperatures that may be expected, including those of possible fire exposure.
Openings for measuring liquid levels in storage tanks for Class I liquids shall be equipped with caps or covers which shall be opened only when measuring the liquid level.
Except as provided in , connections used as part of normal operating conditions for filling or emptying storage tanks for flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be located

clause.text: outside buildings,
at a location free of sources of ignition, and
not less than 1.5 m away from building openings.

sentence.text: Connections for filling or emptying storage tanks shall be kept closed to prevent leakage when not in use.
A filling connection described in is permitted to be located inside a building if

clause.text: this is made necessary

subclause.text: by a process or activity located indoors and to which the tank is directly associated, or
for the collection of used liquids, and

clause.text: the fill piping is provided with means to prevent flammable vapours from returning to the building.

sentence.text: Connections for filling or emptying storage tanks shall be provided with a spill containment device designed to catch, retain and provide for the evacuation of spilled flammable liquids or combustible liquids in conformance with

subsect.title: Secondary Containment for Aboveground Storage Tanks

sentence.text: The area surrounding a storage tank or group of storage tanks shall be designed to accommodate accidental spillage in conformance with
Where barriers described in are provided to contain accidental spillage from aboveground storage tanks, they shall conform to the requirements for secondary containment in this Subsection.
A storage tank conforming to shall be considered as conforming to this Subsection provided it is used and maintained in conformance with
Except as provided in , the base and walls of a secondary containment shall be made of noncombustible materials, and shall be designed, constructed and maintained to

clause.text: withstand full hydrostatic head, and
provide a permeability of not more than 10-6 cm/s to the flammable liquids or combustible liquids contained in the storage tanks.

sentence.text: A membrane providing the level of impermeability required in shall

clause.text: conform to and
if it is combustible, be covered with a noncombustible material that will prevent the membrane from failing in the event that the secondary containment is exposed to fire.

sentence.text: Except as provided in , openings shall not be permitted in a secondary containment.
Where piping passes through a secondary containment, such passages shall conform to .
Except as permitted in , a secondary containment for a single storage tank shall have a volumetric capacity of not less than 110% of the capacity of the tank.
Except as permitted in , a secondary containment for more than one storage tank shall have a volumetric capacity of not less than the sum of

clause.text: the capacity of the largest storage tank located in the contained space, and
10% of the greater of

subclause.text: the capacity specified in , or
the aggregate capacity of all other storage tanks located in the contained space.

sentence.text: When the secondary containment is designed to prevent the entry of precipitation and water used for firefighting purposes into the contained space, it shall have a volumetric capacity of not less than the capacity of the largest storage tank located in the contained space.
Except as provided in , no part of a secondary containment wall shall be less than 1.5 m from a storage tank shell.
The distance required in is permitted to be waived, provided the storage tank

clause.text: has a capacity of not more than 80 000 L and is constructed in accordance with

subclause.text: , incorporating secondary containment, or
for double-walled storage tanks, or

clause.text: conforms to

sentence.text: Aboveground storage tanks shall be protected by posts or guardrails where they are exposed to potential collision damage.

article.title: Access to Storage Tanks and Ancillary Equipment

sentence.text: A secondary containment shall permit

clause.text: access to storage tanks, valves and ancillary equipment,
egress from the contained space, and
access for firefighting as specified in

sentence.text: Where a storage tank contains Class I liquids, provisions shall be made for the normal operation of valves and for access to the storage tank roof without entering the contained space created by the secondary containment where

clause.text: the average height of the secondary containment exceeds 3.5 m, measured from the ground level of the interior of the contained area, or
the distance between the tank shell and the top inside edge of the secondary containment wall is less than the height of this wall.

sentence.text: Where the secondary containment is not open to the atmosphere, emergency venting shall be provided to relieve any buildup of internal pressure in the contained space when exposed to heat or fire.

Where the contained space created by the secondary containment is not accessible for an internal visual examination, and the secondary containment is not sloped so as to permit liquid to flow to a specific location that can be monitored, a monitoring device shall be provided to indicate the loss of integrity of the secondary containment.
Liquids, debris and precipitation shall not accumulate in the contained space created by the secondary containment.
Provisions shall be made for removing liquid from the secondary containment in conformance with
Controls for the liquid removal system required in shall be

clause.text: normally closed,
accessible under fire exposure conditions, and
located so they can be operated from outside the contained space.

sentence.text: Centrifugal type pumps shall not be used to transfer water contaminated with flammable liquids or combustible liquids from diked areas to a collection system.
The contained space created by a secondary containment shall not be used for storage purposes.
Storage tanks installed underground shall be of double-walled construction and shall be built in conformance with the underground storage tank standards identified in .
Underground storage tanks shall be located so that loads from building foundations and supports are not transmitted to the tank.
Underground storage tanks shall be separated by a horizontal distance of not less than

clause.text: 600 mm from adjacent underground tanks or structures,
1 m from a building foundation or a street line, and
1.5 m from other property lines.

sentence.text: Except as required in , underground storage tanks shall be installed with not less than 600 mm of ground cover over the tank.
Except as required in , storage tanks subjected to vehicular traffic shall be installed not less than 1 m below finished ground level.

Either a 150 mm reinforced concrete slab or a 200 mm unreinforced concrete slab over not less than 450 mm of sand is permitted in lieu of the protection described in , provided the slab extends at least 300 mm beyond the storage tank.
Where subsurface conditions make it impracticable to install a storage tank totally below adjacent ground level, an underground storage tank shall be installed so that at least

clause.text: 75% of its mass is below adjacent ground level, provided there is not less than 600 mm of ground cover over the portion of the tank above adjacent ground level, or
50% of its mass is below adjacent ground level, provided there is not less than 1 m of ground cover over the portion of the tank above adjacent ground level.

sentence.text: Underground storage tanks that are in the process of being installed shall be inspected, and any damage to the tank shell, protective coating, fittings or anodes shall be repaired before they are lowered into the excavation.
An underground storage tank that is damaged shall not be repaired on site and used for storage unless

clause.text: the repair is done by the manufacturer in accordance with ULC refurbishing specifications, and
the manufacturer certifies in writing that the repaired tank meets the applicable manufacturing codes.

sentence.text: Underground storage tanks shall be lowered into the excavation by the use of lifting lugs and hooks and, where necessary, spreader bars to prevent damage to the tank shell, protective coating, fittings or anodes.
Any method of handling that might result in damage to the protective coating of the tank shall not be used.
Underground steel storage tanks shall be installed in conformance with Appendix A of
Underground reinforced plastic storage tanks shall be installed in conformance with Appendix B of

Underground storage tanks shall not be placed in direct contact with reinforced concrete slabs but shall be separated by not less than 150 mm of sand or other suitable material to evenly distribute the weight of the tank on the supporting base.
Flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall not be placed in an underground storage tank until

clause.text: the fill pipe and vent line have been installed in the tank, and
all other openings have been sealed.

sentence.text: If a spillage occurs, the escaped liquid and all soil contaminated by the spill shall be removed in conformance with
Underground storage tanks shall be protected against hydrostatic forces which can cause the uplift of the tanks once they are empty. (See .)
Where anchors and ground straps are used to resist the uplift forces referred to in , they shall be

clause.text: electrically isolated from the tank, and
installed in such a manner that they do not damage the tank's shell, protective coating, fittings or anodes.

sentence.text: A dispenser sump shall be provided under a dispenser, unless the dispenser is located on top of an aboveground storage tank.
A spill containment sump shall be provided at every underground storage tank fill point.
A transition sump shall be provided for all mechanical pipe connections located below grade.
A turbine sump shall be provided for all turbine pump assemblies located below grade or above grade where they are not readily visible.
In addition to the requirements of , the sumps referred to in shall be installed in conformance with the sump manufacturer's instructions.
Sumps required by shall be constructed in accordance with

Where dispenser sumps, turbine sumps and transition sumps referred to in are used in underground applications, they shall be provided with an electronic monitoring device to indicate the presence of liquid.

subsect.title: Corrosion Protection of Underground Steel Storage Tanks

sentence.text: Underground steel storage tanks and integral fittings subject to corrosion shall be

clause.text: protected in conformance with or
protected by impressed current in conformance with

sentence.text: Underground storage tanks shall be provided with vent openings and piping of sufficient cross-sectional area designed to vent the tanks during the maximum filling or withdrawal rate without causing the allowable stress for the tank to be exceeded.
Except at distilleries covered in , vent piping materials and construction shall conform to ,
Vent pipe outlets from underground storage tanks for Class I liquids

clause.text: shall be located outside buildings higher than the fill pipe openings but not less than

subclause.text: 3.5 m above the adjacent ground level,
1.5 m from any building opening, and
7.5 m from any dispenser, and

clause.text: shall discharge so that flammable vapours will not enter building openings or be trapped near any part of the building.

sentence.text: Vent pipe outlets from underground storage tanks for Class II or IIIA liquids shall be located outside buildings at a height that is above the fill pipe opening but not less than 2 m above finished ground level.

Vent pipes from underground storage tanks for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall not be obstructed by any device that may cause excessive back pressure, except that vent pipes from underground storage tanks for Class II or IIIA liquids are permitted to be fitted with return bends, coarse screens or other devices to minimize the entry of foreign material.
Vent piping shall enter the storage tank through the top of the tank and shall not extend into the tank more than 25 mm.
Vent piping shall be

clause.text: installed so that any nominally horizontal run shall slope towards the storage tank,
constructed without traps,
adequately supported to prevent sagging, and
where necessary, protected against mechanical damage.

sentence.text: Vent piping shall be tested for leaks at the commissioning stage in conformance with .

Except as permitted in , where vent piping connects 2 or more storage tanks, pipe sizes shall be designed to vent the combined vapours produced in the connected underground storage tanks without exceeding the allowable stresses of the tanks when being filled simultaneously.

Where it is not possible to fill the connected storage tanks referred to in simultaneously, or where the connected vents have a vapour recovery system, the vent piping shall be sized to accommodate the maximum vapour flow possible in the system.

Vent piping for an underground storage tank containing a Class I liquid shall not be connected to the vent piping for a storage tank containing a Class II or IIIA liquid, unless an effective method is provided to prevent the vapours from the Class I liquid storage tank from entering the other tank.

subsect.title: Openings Other than Vents in Underground Storage Tanks

sentence.text: Connections for all openings in underground storage tanks shall be liquid- and vapour-tight.

Openings for measuring liquid levels in underground storage tanks if independent of the fill pipe shall be equipped with a vapour-tight cap or cover which shall be opened only when measuring the liquid level.
Fill piping and discharge piping shall enter underground storage tanks only through the top of the tank and discharge piping used in suction systems shall be sloped toward the storage tanks.
The fill point of an underground storage tank shall not be located higher than the discharge point of the tank's vent.
Except as provided in , connections used as part of normal operating conditions for filling or emptying storage tanks for flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be located

clause.text: outside buildings,
at a location free of sources of ignition, and
not less than 1.5 m away from building openings.

sentence.text: Connections for filling or emptying storage tanks described in shall be kept closed to prevent leakage when not in use.
A filling connection described in is permitted to be located inside a building if

clause.text: this is made necessary

subclause.text: by a process or activity located indoors and to which the storage tank is directly associated, or
for the collection of used liquids, and

clause.text: the fill piping is provided with means to prevent flammable vapours from returning to the building.

sentence.text: If a fill piping system has an offset component from the fill point on the storage tank, all fill pipes shall be

clause.text: double-walled,
sloped to the storage tank, and
electronically monitored for leak detection in conformance with

sentence.text: Where the fill point is below the normal liquid level in the storage tank,

clause.text: the fill line shall be equipped with a manual or automatic valve located at the fill point to prevent spillage when the fill cap is removed, and

if the storage tank contains flammable liquids or combustible liquids, the fill line drop tube shall be equipped with a method to prevent siphoning of the tank's content should a leak occur in the fill line.

subsect.title: Installation of Storage Tanks inside Buildings

sentence.text: Except as provided in , storage tanks located inside buildings shall conform to and be permitted in

clause.text: industrial occupancies, and
occupancies other than industrial occupancies where combustible liquids are stored and used as fuel for oil-burning equipment, emergency generators and fire pumps.

sentence.text: Installations using Class I liquids as fuel supplies for stationary engines inside buildings shall conform to

The static head imposed on a storage tank inside a building shall not exceed 70 kPa (gauge) at the bottom of the tank when the vent or fill pipe is filled with liquid unless the tank is designed for greater pressures.
Except as provided in and in , storage tanks for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be

clause.text: located in dedicated storage rooms conforming to , and
located in conformance with (see ).

table.title.tbl: Indoor Tank Storage in Industrial Occupancies

row.entry: Maximum Quantity per Storage Room See , L

table.title.tbl: Indoor Tank Storage in Occupancies Using Oil-Burning Equipment, Emergency Generators and Fire Pumps

row.entry: Quantity per Protected Storage Room See , L

note.para.note: For industrial occupancies where the tanks are located in a separate storage room from the equipment, refer to .

row.entry: Basement and storeys above the first storey

sentence.text: When quantities greater than those permitted for incidental use in are required for special process operations, storage tanks for flammable liquids or combustible liquids are permitted to be located outside of a storage room referred to in , provided that

clause.text: total quantities per fire compartment are not more than one-half the quantities permitted in ,
they are located on the first storey, and
the installation conforms to

sentence.text: Storage tanks with an individual capacity exceeding 2 500 L but not exceeding 20 000 L that are used in conformance with shall be

clause.text: of double-walled construction in conformance with or a minimum of 300 deg. secondarily contained construction, and
monitored for leakage in conformance with .

sentence.text: Storage tanks with an individual capacity exceeding 20 000 L that are used in conformance with shall

clause.text: conform to , and
be monitored for leakage in conformance with .

sentence.text: Piping systems serving oil-burning equipment, diesel-engine-driven emergency generators and fire pumps shall conform to
Fire compartments regulated by this Subsection shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.

When 2 or more classes of liquids are stored in a single storage room referred to in , the total quantity permitted for each class of liquid shall be calculated as follows:
qIQI+ q II+IIIAQII +IIIA≤1

where qI = actual quantity of Class I liquids present,
qII + IIIA = actual quantity of Class II and IIIA liquids present,
QI = maximum quantity of Class I liquids permitted in , and
QII + IIIA = maximum quantity of Class II and IIIA liquids permitted in .
Where storage tanks for flammable liquids or combustible liquids are located outside of storage rooms conforming to ,

clause.text: provision shall be made to contain a spill equal to at least 100% of the volume of the largest storage tank, or to drain away spilled flammable liquids or combustible liquids, and
the area in which the storage tanks are located shall be ventilated (see ).

sentence.text: Except as provided in , normal and emergency vents for storage tanks in buildings shall be provided in conformance with (See .)

The use of weak roof-to-side shell seams, designed to rupture before the allowable design stress of the storage tank is reached, shall not be permitted as a means of emergency venting of storage tanks inside buildings.

Except as provided in , where storage tanks for flammable liquids or combustible liquids are installed inside buildings, the supports, foundations and anchorage for such storage tanks shall be in conformance with
Where a storage tank is suspended, rather than supported on a foundation, supports shall be designed and installed in conformance with good engineering practice. (See .)
Where storage tanks for flammable liquids or combustible liquids are installed inside buildings, tanks, piping and discharge equipment shall be bonded and grounded.
Rooms for storage tanks inside buildings, referred to in , shall be

clause.text: separated from the rest of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of at least 2 h,
designed to contain a spill equal to at least 100% of the volume of the largest storage tank, or to drain away spilled flammable liquids or combustible liquids,
made liquid-tight where the walls join the floor, and
used for no other purposes than the storage and handling of flammable liquids or combustible liquids.

sentence.text: A minimum clear space of 550 mm shall be maintained between the walls of a room described in and the sides of any storage tanks within the room.

Where Class IA or IB liquids are dispensed within a storage room, the room shall be designed to prevent critical structural and mechanical damage from an internal explosion in conformance with (See .)

Placards conforming to that identify the liquids stored as flammable liquids or combustible liquids and the capacities of the storage tanks shall be posted in a conspicuous location outside of the room.

subsect.title: Openings Other than Vents in Storage Tanks inside Buildings

sentence.text: Connections for all openings in storage tanks in buildings shall be liquid- and vapour-tight.
Connections to storage tanks through which liquid can flow shall be provided with valves located as close as practicable to the tank.
Connections for filling or emptying storage tanks shall be provided with a spill containment device in accordance with .

Openings that are independent of the fill pipe and are used for measuring the liquid level in storage tanks containing Class I or II liquids shall be equipped with a vapour-tight cap which shall be opened only when measuring the liquid level.
Openings referred to in shall be protected against overflow and vapour pressure by means of a spring-loaded check valve.
When underground storage tanks will be out of service for a period not exceeding 180 days,

clause.text: the liquid level in the storage tank shall be measured at intervals not greater than one month and a record of the measurements shall be retained in conformance with ,
fill pipe covers and covers over openings to measure liquid levels, dispensers and power controls shall be kept locked when not in use, and
vent piping shall be kept open.

sentence.text: Except as provided in , when underground storage tanks will be out of service for a period exceeding 180 days,

clause.text: the authority having jurisdiction shall be notified, in writing, as soon as practicable,
the storage tanks, connected piping and dispensers shall be emptied of Class I liquid, and
fill pipe covers and covers over openings to measure liquid levels, dispensers and power controls shall be locked.

sentence.text: Where underground storage tank facilities are operated on a seasonal basis,

clause.text: at the close of each season of operation,

subclause.text: the liquid level of each storage tank shall be measured,
a record of the measurements shall be retained in conformance with , and
all fill pipe covers and covers over openings for measuring liquid levels, dispensers and power controls shall be locked, and

clause.text: before the start of each season of operation,

subclause.text: the liquid level in each storage tank shall be measured,
the measurements shall be compared with those recorded at the close of the previous season, and
when a loss of liquid or water intrusion is apparent, immediate action shall be taken to determine and correct the condition.

sentence.text: When an underground storage tank is to be reused for the storage of flammable liquids or combustible liquids, the authority having jurisdiction shall be notified.
If an underground storage tank has been out of service for more than 12 months, the tank and piping shall be tested for leakage in conformance with

When an aboveground storage tank will be out of service or unsupervised for a period not exceeding 180 days, the piping from the tank shall be capped or the valves that are necessary to achieve similar isolation of the tank shall be closed and securely locked.

Where a storage tank referred to in contains flammable liquids or combustible liquids, the liquid level in the tank shall be measured and compared with subsequent readings taken at intervals not greater than one month.
When an aboveground storage tank will be out of service or unsupervised for a period exceeding 180 days, all liquid and vapours shall be removed from the storage tank and its connected piping.

Aboveground storage tanks that have been out of service for a period of more than 180 days and are to be returned to service shall, where possible, be internally inspected and the authority having jurisdiction shall be advised of the inspection results and the intention to return the storage tanks to service.
When a storage tank is to be permanently disposed of, sufficient openings shall be cut in the tank to render it unfit for further use.
The removal, abandonment in place, disposal or temporary taking out of service of an underground piping system shall be in conformance with good engineering practice. (See .)
Corrosion protection systems shall be maintained in operating condition when a storage tank is temporarily out of service and during seasonal shutdowns.

subsect.title: Removal and Abandonment in Place of Underground Storage Tanks

sentence.text: Except as permitted in , when an underground storage tank system has no further use or has been out of service for 2 years,

clause.text: the owner shall notify the authority having jurisdiction in writing at least 30 days before the removal of an underground storage tank system,
storage tanks shall have all flammable liquids and combustible liquids removed from them,
storage tanks shall be purged of vapours and removed from the ground (see ), and
the associated piping shall be

subclause.text: purged of vapours and the ends permanently sealed by capping or plugging, or
removed from the ground.

sentence.text: If soil surrounding the storage tanks described in is found to be contaminated, the owner shall

clause.text: notify the authority having jurisdiction,
when requested, provide a report showing the extent of the site soil contamination, and
remove, treat or replace the contaminated soil in a manner acceptable to the authority having jurisdiction.

sentence.text: If it is impracticable to remove an underground storage tank, the owner shall apply to the authority having jurisdiction for permission to abandon the storage tank in place.
An owner who makes application for permission to abandon a storage tank in place in accordance with shall

clause.text: describe in the application the reasons why it is impracticable to remove the storage tank and provide other information that supports the application,
satisfy the authority having jurisdiction that the soil under and around the storage tank has not been contaminated with petroleum product, and
provide confirmation that the owner of the property is aware of the application and agrees with the plan to abandon the storage tank in place.

sentence.text: The owner may be granted permission to abandon the storage tank in place if the authority having jurisdiction is satisfied that the storage tank is

clause.text: located in whole or in part beneath a permanent building or other facility, making excavation impracticable,
of a size or type of construction that makes excavation impracticable,
inaccessible to the heavy equipment necessary for removal of the storage tank, or
situated so that removal of the storage tank would endanger the structural integrity of nearby buildings or other facilities.

sentence.text: If the authority having jurisdiction grants permission to abandon a storage tank in place in accordance with , the owner shall

clause.text: purge the storage tank of vapours to less than 10% of the lower explosive limit,
check for the presence of vapours using combustible gas detection equipment,
arrange for a certified person to enter the storage tank and conduct an internal inspection of the storage tank for perforations,
notify the authority having jurisdiction if the storage tank is perforated,
conduct additional investigations or take remedial actions in accordance with directions issued by the authority having jurisdiction,
remove sludge from the storage tank and dispose of it in a manner acceptable to the authority having jurisdiction,
make holes along the top of the storage tank large enough to permit filling the storage tank with inert material,
fill the storage tank with sand, gravel, concrete or other inert material acceptable to the authority having jurisdiction, and
remove associated piping from service in conformance with .

sentence.text: If it is considered impracticable to carry out the internal inspection required by , the owner shall conduct precision leak tests if so directed by the authority having jurisdiction. (See )

section.title: Leak Detection of Storage Tanks and Piping Systems

sentence.text: Except as provided in and except as otherwise specified in this Code, this Section provides the minimum requirements regarding the detection of leaks in aboveground and underground storage tanks, piping systems and sumps.
This Section shall not apply to storage tanks that have been taken out of service in compliance with the applicable provisions of

article.title: Frequency and Methods of Leak Detection Testing and Monitoring

sentence.text: Every storage tank, piping system and sump, including those at fuel-dispensing stations, shall be tested and monitored for leaks in conformance with , which establish the minimum requirements regarding the frequency and methods to be used for

clause.text: commissioning testing,
subsequent in-service monitoring, and
testing when a leak is suspected.

sentence.text: The methods referred to in shall conform to
The commissioning testing referred to in shall be performed at the time of installation

clause.text: once backfill and surfacing have been completed but before being put into service, in the case of an underground storage tank or underground piping system,
before being put into service, in the case of an aboveground storage tank or exposed piping system, and
once the final surface materials have been installed but before being put into service, in the case of a sump.

sentence.text: The frequency of the in-service monitoring referred to in shall be calculated from the date of the commissioning test.
Immediate action shall be taken when a leak is suspected and the leak detection testing referred to in shall be performed if

clause.text: a loss of liquid or a gain of water is indicated by any of the leak detection measures described in this Section, or
the level of water at the bottom of an underground storage tank exceeds 50 mm.

sentence.text: Where dispenser sumps, transition sumps and turbine sumps are provided with electronic monitoring devices in accordance with , the devices shall be interlocked with the dispenser or pump to shut it down upon detection of either product or a high liquid level.
The minimum requirements referred to in shall not preclude the appropriate use of alternative solutions, innovative new technologies, or methods capable of achieving the same objectives. (See .)

table.title.tbl: Leak Detection Testing and Monitoring of Underground Storage Tanks

row.entry: Single-walledApplies to single-walled storage tanks of typical construction, including storage tanks that do not meet the requirements for double-walled storage tanks.
Not applicableNot applicable because underground storage tanks must be of double-walled construction as per .
Precision Leak Detection Test every 2 years

entry.para: Precision Leak Detection Test every 5 years

row.entry: Double-walledApplies to double-walled storage tanks, which have an interstitial space that allows for monitoring using high- or low-tech methods.

Precision Leak Detection Test or Secondary Containment TestThe Secondary Containment Test is a precision test capable of detecting leaks in the interstitial space of the storage tank. Risers, connections and vents are also susceptible to leakage and must therefore also be precision-tested.
Precision Leak Detection Test or Secondary Containment Test

table.title.tbl: Leak Detection Testing and Monitoring of Aboveground Storage Tanks

row.entry:
Contained openApplies to storage tanks contained in an open arrangement that do not meet the requirements for double-walled storage tanks.
vertical tank
Visual inspection Visual leak detection may apply to single- or double-walled storage tanks and piping. See . during Liquid Media Test
Inventory Reconciliation and Secondary Containment Monitoring
Visual inspection during Liquid Media Test
Double-walledApplies to double-walled storage tanks, which have an interstitial space that allows for monitoring using high- or low-tech methods.

table.title.tbl: Leak Detection Testing and Monitoring of Underground Piping Systems

row.entry: Single-walledApplies to single-walled piping systems of typical construction, including piping systems that do not meet the requirements for double-walled piping systems. and single-walled, buried mechanical threaded connectionsSee
Not applicableNot applicable because underground piping systems must be of double-walled construction as per .

Pipe Leak Detection TestThe Pipe Leak Detection Test results shall conform to with a probability of detection of 0.95 or greater and a probability of false alarm of 0.05 or less. every 2 years (annually for mechanical connections)
Pipe Leak Detection Test every 5 years (annually for mechanical connections)
Single Check ValveApplies to suction line only.
Electronic Line Leak Detection (with a detectable limit of 0.76 L/h monthly)
Electronic Line Leak Detection (with a detectable limit of 0.38 L/h annually)
Continuous Electronic Line and Tank Leak Detection (with a detectable limit of 0.76 L/h monthly)
Continuous Electronic Line and Tank Leak Detection (with a detectable limit of 0.38 L/h annually)

Double-walledApplies to double-walled piping systems, which have an interstitial space that allows for monitoring using high- or low-tech methods. Monitoring of the sump using high-tech methods in accordance with is considered as meeting the requirements for monitoring of an open-draining interstitial space of double-walled piping.
Pipe Leak Detection Test and Secondary Containment Test The Secondary Containment Test shall conform to
Pipe Leak Detection Test or Secondary Containment Test

table.title.tbl: Leak Detection Testing and Monitoring of Exposed Piping Systems

row.entry: Single-walledApplies to single-walled piping systems of typical construction, including piping systems that do not meet the requirements for double-walled or contained open piping systems.
Pipe Leak Detection TestThe Pipe Leak Detection Test results shall conform to with a probability of detection of 0.95 or greater and a probability of false alarm of 0.05 or less. every 12 months
Double-walledApplies to double-walled piping systems with an interstitial space contiguous to the primary containment that can be monitored using high- or low-tech methods.
Contained openApplies to piping systems contained in an open arrangement that do not meet the requirements for double-walled piping systems and do not conform to

table.title.tbl: Leak Detection Testing and Monitoring of Turbine, Transition, Dispenser and Spill Containment Sumps

row.entry: Static Liquid Media Leak Detection TestSee
Weekly visual inspection or electronic monitoringElectronic monitoring devices need to be tested at least once annually in conformance with the manufacturer's recommendations.
Weekly visual inspection at fill point

sentence.text: Except as provided in , when a leak detection test required by this Section detects a leak in a storage tank, piping system or sump, the leaking components or system shall be

clause.text: repaired and tested,
replaced, or
removed.

sentence.text: When a leak detection test required by this Section detects a leak in a single-walled construction underground storage tank or piping system, the leaking components or system shall be

clause.text: replaced in conformance with , or
taken out of service in conformance with

sentence.text: Where a leak is detected as described in , the escaped liquid shall be removed in conformance with
Records of the tests referred to in this Section shall be retained in conformance with .

subsect.title: Leak Detection Testing and Monitoring Methods

article.title: Definition and Performance of Leak Detection Testing and Monitoring Methods

sentence.text: This Subsection applies to the leak detection testing and monitoring methods referred to in this Section.
Inventory reconciliation referred to in this Section shall

clause.text: for the time period designated, determine product loss or gain based on the reconciliation of

subclause.text: change in physical inventory,
inventory additions (deliveries),
inventory removals (sales), and
miscellaneous inventory alterations, and

clause.text: determine the level of water in the tank.

sentence.text: A leak detection method that monitors vapours in the soil or liquids on the groundwater shall conform to good engineering practice and meet the requirements of vapour monitoring or groundwater monitoring systems. (See .)
Statistical inventory reconciliation (SIR) methodology shall be capable of detecting a leak

clause.text: of 0.38 L/h with a probability of detection of 0.95 or greater and a probability of false alarm of 0.05 or less, based on an inventory record of specified length to be considered as an annual test, or
of 0.76 L/h with a probability of detection of 0.95 or greater and a probability of false alarm of 0.05 or less, based on an inventory record of specified length to be considered as a monthly test.

sentence.text: Where inventory reconciliation is performed using automatic tank gauging referred to in , the system shall conform to good engineering practice and meet the requirements of a precision leak detection test when a leak is suspected in conformance with . (See .)
A continuous in-tank leak detection system shall conform to good engineering practice and meet the requirements of a precision leak detection test. (See .)

High-tech secondary containment monitoring referred to in this Section shall include the use of an automatic device that continuously monitors the interstitial space between the inner tank or inner piping and the secondary containment. (See .) (See for low-tech method.)
Visual inspection referred to in this Section shall,

clause.text: in the case of an exposed piping system, conform to , and
in the case of an aboveground storage tank, consist of

subclause.text: a visual examination of the tank shell, or
if the bottom of the tank is not amenable to a visual examination, testing the bottom of the tank (see ).

sentence.text: A static liquid media leak detection test shall conform to
The precision leak detection test for underground storage tanks that is referred to in this Section shall

clause.text: be capable of detecting a storage tank leak rate as small as 0.38 L/h within 24 h with a probability of detection of 0.95 or greater and a probability of false alarm of 0.05 or less (see ), and
be conducted by an individual who has been trained in the proper care and use of the test equipment and the operating procedures.

sentence.text: Pipe leak detection referred to in this Section shall conform to (See also )
A single vertical check valve referred to in this Section shall

clause.text: consist of a vertical check valve located immediately under the pump,
be installed with no other check valve between the suction pump and the storage tank, and
be part of an installation where lines must be sufficiently sloped so that any liquid in the line will drain back into the storage tank should a leak occur in the piping system.

subsect.title: Leak Detection Testing of Storage Tanks, Piping Systems and Sumps

sentence.text: Where field test methods are included in the storage tank construction standards referred to in , such tests shall be permitted for storage tanks conforming to those standards.
If a precision leak detection test referred to in detects a leak rate exceeding 0.38 L/h on an underground storage tank, the tank shall be considered to be leaking.
During a leak detection test on a storage tank, the pressure at the bottom of the tank shall not exceed the tank manufacturer's specifications.
Pneumatic leak detection tests using compressed air shall not be performed on storage tanks and piping systems having once contained flammable liquids or combustible liquids.

Except as provided in , pneumatic leak detection tests using compressed air or an inert gas shall include the application of soap and water to the storage tank and piping surface, fittings, joints and connections to help in the detection of leaks.
In the case of underground storage tanks or piping, the test referred to in shall be conducted prior to covering the tank or piping system.

Where a pneumatic leak detection test is conducted before an underground storage tank is backfilled, in the case of a new tank, or after the tank is uncovered, in the case of a previously installed tank, the test pressure shall be in conformance with the production testing requirements of

clause.text: or

sentence.text: Pneumatic leak detection tests shall not be performed on field-erected aboveground storage tanks.

Measures shall be taken to guard against the hazards associated with pneumatic leak detection testing in areas where explosive mixtures of flammable liquid or combustible liquid vapours and air may be present in the vicinity of a storage tank that has been in use.

article.title: Protocols for Pneumatic Leak Detection Testing of Piping Systems

sentence.text: A pressure decline test using an inert gas is permitted to be used as a leak detection test for piping systems that

clause.text: are new or in use, and
convey a volume of less than 1 000 L.

sentence.text: A pressure decline test performed on a piping system shall conform to .
The design and installation of the piping system permitting, the piping system's contents shall be drained prior to conducting the pressure decline test procedure.

Pumps, dispensers and other auxiliary equipment that are connected to the piping system and cannot withstand the pressure of the test shall be isolated from the test procedure to prevent damage to the equipment.
A stabilization period of up to 30 min is required after pressurization.
Pipe volumes of 500 L or less shall be pressurized for at least 60 min after stabilization.
Pipe volumes greater than 500 L but less than 1 000 L shall be pressurized for at least 2 h after stabilization.
Test pressures shall

clause.text: be the greater of 350 kPa (gauge) or 1.5 times the maximum operating pressure, and
not exceed the piping manufacturer's test specifications.

sentence.text: The piping system shall be considered to be leaking if any pressure decline is detected within the time periods stated.

article.title: Protocols for Liquid Media Leak Detection Testing of Piping Systems

sentence.text: Liquid media leak detection testing of piping systems shall conform to .
Test devices and methods shall conform to the performance requirements of
Tests shall be conducted by an individual who has been trained in the proper use of the test device and the operating procedures.
A sufficient amount of time shall be allocated to stabilize the temperature of the liquid throughout the volume of the piping during the test.
Except as provided in , test pressure shall

clause.text: be the greater of 350 kPa (gauge) or 1.5 times the maximum operating pressure, and
not exceed the piping manufacturer's test specifications.

sentence.text: Test pressures exceeding 700 kPa (gauge) shall not be permitted unless the piping system is designed for such pressures.
Where test pressures exceed the design pressures for pumps or similar components connected to the piping system being tested, such pumps or components shall be isolated from the test procedure.

Class I liquids shall not be used for pressure testing piping systems, except that pressure piping normally containing Class I liquids is permitted to be tested with such liquids at pressures not exceeding their maximum operating pressures.
The piping system shall be considered to be leaking if the leak rate exceeds 0.38 L/h.

article.title: Protocols for Leak Detection Testing of Sumps

sentence.text: Static liquid media leak detection testing of turbine, transition, dispenser and pump sumps shall conform to .

Static liquid media testing of sumps shall be performed at the installation stage after all electrical and mechanical work passing through the sump wall has been completed, but before any backfilling around the exterior of the sump is completed.
The liquid used for the test shall

clause.text: exceed the elevation of the piping and other points of entry into the sump by at least 50 mm, and
not be a flammable liquid or a combustible liquid.

sentence.text: The minimum duration of the test shall be 1 h with no visual or measured evidence of leakage.

subsect.title: Leak Detection Monitoring of Storage Tanks and Piping Systems

sentence.text: Where inventory reconciliation is required by this Section, the liquid level in any storage tank shall be measured at intervals not greater than 7 days in conformance with , except that at fuel-dispensing stations the measurements shall be taken each day the station is in operation.

The level of water at the bottom of an underground storage tank shall be measured at intervals not greater than 7 days, except that at fuel-dispensing stations the measurements shall be taken each day the station is in operation.
Investigative action shall be undertaken if the inventory reconciliation described in indicates the following inexplicable conditions:

clause.text: a monthly loss of

subclause.text: 0.5 percent or more of the throughput from an underground storage tank, or
1.0 percent or more of the throughput from an aboveground storage tank,

clause.text: three consecutive losses greater than 200 L/day, and
a water level greater than 50 mm.

sentence.text: A record of the measurements for each storage tank and of the computations described in shall be retained in conformance with .
Where continuous leak detection is provided on an underground piping system, it shall conform to
This Section applies to piping and transfer systems for flammable liquids and combustible liquids.
Except where otherwise stated in this Part, this Section shall not apply to the following:

clause.text: tubing or casings and piping for oil or gas wells,
transmission pipelines,
piping for vehicles, aircraft, watercraft and portable or stationary engines,
piping systems in fuel-dispensing stations and distilleries, and
piping that falls within the scope of the applicable provincial or territorial codes regulating boilers and pressure vessels.

subsect.title: Materials for Piping, Valves and Fittings

sentence.text: Materials for piping systems containing flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be suitable for the maximum anticipated working pressures and operating temperatures and for the chemical properties of the contained liquid.
Except as provided in , the use of the following materials for piping systems referred to in shall not be permitted:

clause.text: materials that are subject to failure from internal stress or rupture by mechanical damage, or
combustible or low-melting-point materials that are subject to failure even in moderate fires.

sentence.text: Metallic and non-metallic piping systems are permitted to be used for underground installations, provided they conform to
Except as provided in , where steel piping is used, it shall conform to

clause.text: or

sentence.text: Where service pressures exceeding 875 kPa (gauge) may occur, piping and fittings shall be designed in conformance with
Underground piping systems shall include piping in tank sumps, transition sumps and dispenser sumps.

Where problems of corrosion, contamination, or sanitation or standards of purity require special materials, it is permitted to use non-metallic materials for piping, valves and fittings in conformance with .
Underground metallic piping systems in contact with the soil or groundwater shall be protected against corrosion in conformance with

clause.text: or

sentence.text: Pipelines for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be marked with the contents of the line, and these markings shall be maintained in a clearly legible form.
Piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall not be painted red.
Transfer points in piping systems for flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be identified in conformance with
Documentation on the piping systems for flammable liquids or combustible liquids, including the tank and pumping arrangements, shall be made available to the fire department upon request.
Documents referred to in shall be kept at two separate locations so that one copy remains readily available in the event the other is inaccessible due to fire.
Threaded joints in piping systems for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be made using joint compound or polytetrafluoroethylene tape conforming to

Welding of piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall conform to and to the appropriate provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws, or in the absence of such regulations, to
Flanged joints for piping shall be provided in welded systems at intervals that will facilitate dismantling and avoid subsequent in-place cutting and welding operations.
Except as permitted in , flanged joints for piping shall be made with forged or cast steel flanges designed, constructed and installed in conformance with
Bronze flanges for 50 mm diameter or smaller size piping referred to in are permitted to be used where copper and brass piping is permitted.
Bolting materials for flanged connections in steel piping systems for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be of alloy steel equivalent to Grade B-7.
Gaskets in flanged connections shall be of a material resistant to the liquid being carried and capable of withstanding temperatures of at least 650°C without damage that would impair their function.
Mechanical connections in underground piping systems shall

clause.text: be readily accessible for inspection and maintenance,
not be in direct contact with the soil, and
be provided within a transition sump.

sentence.text: All penetrations into a sump shall be situated at least 50 mm from the bottom of the sump. (See .)
Except for vent risers and vertical fill piping systems, underground piping systems shall be of double-walled construction. (See .)
Piping shall be installed outdoors whenever possible and located so it will not create a hazard to buildings or equipment.
Where piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids is installed within a building, the length of piping shall be as direct and as short as practicable.
It is not permitted to use any portion of a piping system in a manner that could damage it or for any purpose other than the transfer of product.
Vent piping and connections for filling and emptying storage tanks shall be located in conformance with
Aboveground outdoor piping shall be supported and arranged to prevent excessive vibration and stress on equipment connected to it.
Where vehicular, watercraft or aircraft impact or physical damage is possible, protective guarding devices shall be provided for aboveground outdoor piping.
Aboveground piping systems shall be supported such that they are not in direct contact with the surface of the ground.
Aboveground outdoor piping shall not be located

clause.text: on the exterior of walls except on those of noncombustible construction, or
above windows.

sentence.text: Aboveground outdoor piping shall not be located above roofs, except above roofs of impermeable and noncombustible construction with provision for accidental spillage provided in conformance with
Where aboveground piping crosses roadways or railway sidings, ample overhead clearance and warning signs indicating the clearance height shall be provided.
Piping passing though the secondary containment walls of an aboveground storage tank shall be designed to prevent excessive stress resulting from settlement or fire exposure.
Underground piping shall be located so it will not be damaged as a result of vibrations or settling of an adjacent building or structure.
Underground piping shall be located not less than 300 mm away from the foundations of any building or structure, except where such piping enters the building as permitted in
Piping passing under railway tracks shall be installed in conformance with
Piping adjacent to railway tracks shall be installed in conformance with
Underground piping shall be

clause.text: supported on

subclause.text: undisturbed or compacted soil, or
not less than 150 mm of clean sand, pea gravel or clean crushed stone, and

clause.text: backfilled on the top and sides with not less than

subclause.text: 300 mm of pea gravel or clean crushed stone, or
300 mm of clean sand, free of cinders and stones, and compacted in layers not more than 300 mm thick.

sentence.text: Piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall not be located in service tunnels that are used for pedestrian traffic other than maintenance personnel.
Piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be located aboveground where the piping enters a building.
Piping referred to in shall be provided with inside and outside shut-off valves.
Where piping referred to in passes through a wall that would restrict the expansion or contraction of the piping, pipe sleeves shall be provided at the wall penetration to facilitate such movement.
Indoor piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall either be supported overhead or be located in trenches conforming to
Piping referred to in shall not be installed under combustible flooring.
Piping in trenches referred to in shall be covered with noncombustible material.
Where indoor piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids is installed in trenches, a trapped drainage system shall be provided.

When piping referred to in contains Class I liquids, the trench shall be provided with ventilation designed to prevent the accumulation of flammable vapours in accordance with Sentence 6.9.1.2.(2) of Division B of the .

Overhead piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be installed close to the ceiling or beams or along walls not less than 1.8 m above the floor to protect it against mechanical damage.
Where practicable, overhead piping referred to in shall be supported from building framing members.
In buildings of steel frame construction, piping referred to in shall be fastened to steel beams or columns by pipe hangers attached to the flanges.
Piping under concrete ceilings shall be suspended with the use of through bolts or expansion shields.
Piping shall be supported on pipe hangers or other supports so that allowable stresses in the pipe are not exceeded. (See .)
Anchors of the expansion shield type used to suspend piping shall not be used to suspend piping from unsound or lightweight concrete or from gypsum assemblies.
Exposed pipe risers shall be protected against mechanical damage by

clause.text: installing such risers

subclause.text: adjacent to walls or pilasters,
between flanges of steel columns, or
within securely anchored larger perforated pipe, and

clause.text: providing mechanical guards where the risers are exposed to mobile equipment.

sentence.text: In the design of piping systems for flammable liquids or combustible liquids, provision shall be made for the expansion and contraction of the piping system and of the product it conveys.
To prevent excessive stresses resulting from vibration, settling or temperature changes,

clause.text: flexible non-metallic hose connectors conforming to are permitted to be used where necessary in underground piping systems carrying flammable liquids or combustible liquids,
flexible metallic and non-metallic pipe and fittings conforming to are permitted to be used where necessary in underground piping systems carrying flammable liquids or combustible liquids, or
flexible metallic hose connectors conforming to are permitted to be used where necessary in aboveground and underground piping systems carrying flammable liquids or combustible liquids.

sentence.text: Except as provided in , valves in piping systems for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be designed to accommodate the temperatures and pressures of those systems and shall conform to
Every hose nozzle valve shall conform to
Every emergency valve shall conform to
Shut-off valves shall be provided in all flammable liquid or combustible liquid piping and pumping systems.
Where practicable, valves referred to in shall be located outdoors or be immediately accessible from outdoors.
Except as permitted in , steel shut-off valves shall be provided

clause.text: at connections to all aboveground storage tanks,
on supply piping where it enters buildings or structures,
on branch lines from the main supply line,
on supply lines at dispensing locations,
to isolate one part of a piping system from another, and
to isolate meters and air eliminators.

sentence.text: Stainless steel, monel metal or lined steel bodied valves are permitted to be used when special conditions warrant their use.
Diaphragm valves shall have no direct connections between the liquid and air sections that might permit leakage of the liquid past the packing into the air lines.
Globe valves shall be arranged so that the packing is on the low pressure side.
Rising stem or other indicating valves shall be used where necessary to determine whether the valves are open or shut.
All valves shall be identified in conformance with
Every identification tag shall be kept clean so that its colour and inscription are easily recognizable.
Heating equipment for piping systems containing flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be designed not to overheat or create an ignition source for the liquids being heated.
Flammable liquid and combustible liquid piping is permitted to be heated by steam lines provided the minimum steam temperature and pressure to make the liquid fluid are used and are complied with.
A pressure regulator shall be provided in the steam line with a relief valve on the downstream side of the regulator.
Piping and steam lines shall be enclosed in insulation conforming to the .
Electrical heating cables including electrical induction heating shall conform to
Thermal electrical conduction heating conforming to is permitted to be used by passing a low-voltage alternating current through the pipe.
Systems permitted in shall be installed and tested as complete units and shall conform to the following:

clause.text: unheated sections of piping shall be isolated from heated sections by means of nonconductive fittings,
thermostatic controls, high temperature limit controls and fuses shall have the lowest practical rating to ensure satisfactory operation,
all parts of the piping and fittings shall be enclosed by insulating coverings of a type that will prevent accidental grounding of the systems, and
switches, transformers, contactors and other spark-producing equipment shall be located in an area not subject to flammable vapours.

sentence.text: Upon completion of installation, systems permitted in shall be tested to ensure that all components are functioning as intended.
The use of open flames as a heat source shall not be permitted for heating piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids.

subsect.title: Methods of Transfer in Piping Systems

sentence.text: Pumps for flammable liquid or combustible liquid piping systems installed aboveground and outside of buildings shall be located not less than

clause.text: 3 m from the property line, and
1.5 m from building openings.

sentence.text: Pumps located indoors shall be in rooms built in conformance with (See .)
Pump houses and pump rooms shall not be used for any purpose other than to serve the pumping equipment.

Pits for subsurface pumps for piping systems or for piping connected to submersible pumps shall be designed to withstand the forces to which they may be subjected without causing damage to the system.
Pits provided in conformance with shall not be larger than necessary for inspection and maintenance and shall be provided with a cover.
Pumps for piping systems shall be provided with duplicate control switches to shut down the pumps in case of emergency, with one located in the operating area and the other at a remote location.
Where flammable liquids or combustible liquids are transferred by water pressure as a result of displacement, such system shall not be used for liquids that are miscible in water.
All pressure vessels for hydraulic transfer systems referred to in shall be constructed, installed and tested in conformance with
Hydraulic transfer systems referred to in shall be designed to prevent water pressure in excess of the design pressure of the tank or piping.
Operating pressures shall be controlled by a constant-level float valve or a pressure-regulating valve on the water supply side of the hydraulic transfer system referred to in .
Hydraulic transfer systems referred to in shall be arranged so that there is no water pressure on the system except when liquid is being discharged.
Check valves shall be provided for both water and flammable liquid or combustible liquid piping to prevent backflow in hydraulic transfer systems referred to in .

Where flammable liquids or combustible liquids are transferred as a result of displacement by the expansion of nitrogen, carbon dioxide or other inert gases, all pressure vessels involved shall be constructed, installed and tested in conformance with

Pressure regulators for inert gas transfer systems referred to in shall be provided in the gas line to control the pressure of the gas at the minimum pressure required to force the liquid through the piping system at the required rate.
A relief valve with a slightly higher setting than the pressure required in shall be provided on the downstream side of the regulator or on the tank.
Means of automatically shutting off the gas supply and bleeding the gas pressure in the event of fire shall be provided on all inert gas transfer systems referred to in .
Except as permitted in , the transfer of flammable liquids or combustible liquids in a closed piping system by means of compressed air or other non-inert gas pressure shall not be permitted.
A non-inert gas pressure is permitted to be used in a closed piping system referred to in , provided

clause.text: it is the vapour or gas of the flammable liquid or combustible liquid being transferred, or
it is a vapour or gas that will not support combustion reaction and is non-reactive with the flammable liquid or combustible liquid being transferred.

sentence.text: Standard procedures for normal operation and for emergencies shall be given in printed form to all employees engaged in the operation of equipment for the transfer of flammable liquids or combustible liquids and shall be posted for convenient reference.
All employees concerned with transfer operations involving flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be trained in

clause.text: the procedures referred to in ,
the importance of constant attendance during all loading or unloading operations,
extinguishing procedures for fires involving flammable liquids and combustible liquids, and
the flammable liquid and combustible liquid colour coding and identification system required in

sentence.text: Employees engaged in the operation of equipment for the transfer of flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be trained in the location, function and operation of valves used for the operation of fire protection equipment and manual emergency shut-off valves.
Signs indicating the location of valves used for the operation of fire protection equipment and manual emergency shut-off valves shall be posted in conspicuous locations.
At least one portable extinguisher having a rating of 80-B:C shall be provided in the vicinity of pumps and ancillary equipment used for the transfer of flammable liquids or combustible liquids.
A visual inspection routine for the prompt detection of obviously abnormal conditions shall be established and shall be performed at least once each shift.

A visual inspection shall be made at least once during each day of operation of all aboveground piping systems, pumps and other ancillary equipment to detect leakage, and any leakage shall be repaired as quickly as practicable.
Where necessary, flammable vapour indicators shall be used to detect leakage.
Open flames and spark-producing devices shall not be used for leakage detection referred to in .

To ensure proper operation, monthly inspections and tests shall be made of all safety shut-off valves and other fire safety devices, with particular attention directed to normally open, fusible-link-operated valves, float valves and automatic controls.
Except as provided in , maintenance shall not be carried out on piping systems while they are under pressure.
If connections or piping are to be opened, the system shall be drained of flammable liquids and combustible liquids.
Where equipment for handling flammable liquids or combustible liquids has to be repaired, it shall be removed and taken to maintenance areas when possible.
Tags shall be attached to all valves on piping systems that are shut off for maintenance purposes to indicate that such valves are not to be opened.
Piping that has been used for the transfer of flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be removed or capped when it is no longer intended to be used.
The maintenance of pressurized piping systems shall be carried out in conformance with good engineering practice. (See .)
This Section applies to the storage, handling and use of flammable liquids, combustible liquids and dangerous goods classified as flammable gases at fuel-dispensing stations.
Except as provided in this Section, the storage and dispensing of dangerous goods classified as flammable gases at fuel-dispensing stations shall conform to

clause.text: and

sentence.text: Requirements of this Section that pertain to the location of dispensers, storage tanks, pumps, piping and their ancillary equipment inside buildings shall not apply to a canopy that is open on not less than 75% of its perimeter.
Except as provided in , the installation of outside aboveground storage tanks at fuel-dispensing stations shall be in conformance with

Except as permitted in , outside aboveground storage tanks at fuel-dispensing stations shall have an individual capacity of not more than 80 000 L, and their aggregate capacity shall not exceed 200 000 L.
The individual capacity of outside aboveground storage tanks at fuel-dispensing stations is permitted to exceed the individual capacity limit of 80 000 L required in , provided

clause.text: they conform to and
their aggregate capacity does not exceed 200 000 L.

sentence.text: Outside aboveground storage tanks at fuel-dispensing stations shall be provided with

clause.text: physical protection against collision damage,
measures to prevent unauthorized access to the storage tank and its ancillary equipment,
measures to contain accidental spillage in conformance with ,
an overfill protection device in conformance with , where a tight-filled connection is provided, and
where the piping is connected to the storage tank at a point that is lower than the maximum fill level, an external valve to prevent gravity discharge in the event the piping is severed.

sentence.text: In cases where a compartmentalized tank is used, the entire tank shall be treated as one tank with the aggregate of all compartments totaling the total capacity of that tank.

All packaged flammable liquid and combustible liquid products stored or sold at a fuel-dispensing station shall be in closed containers conforming to , distinctly marked with the generic name of the liquid they contain.
All piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids at a fuel-dispensing station shall be in conformance with
Joints in piping systems shall comply with
Underground piping systems shall comply with .
Piping shall be supported and backfilled in accordance with the manufacturer's instructions.
In the design of the piping system, provisions shall be made for the expansion, contraction, vibration, settling and temperature changes of piping in accordance with
All piping, valves and fittings at a fuel-dispensing station shall be protected against corrosion in conformance with
Piping shall be firmly supported and protected by means of guarding devices where necessary to prevent vehicular, watercraft or aircraft impact damage, or other physical damage.
Pits for subsurface pumps or for piping connected to submersed pumps shall conform to
Fixed dispensers for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall conform to
Dispenser sumps shall conform to the construction and performance requirements of
Fixed dispensers for Class I liquids shall be installed outside buildings and not less than

clause.text: 3 m from any right-of-way and any property line,
3 m from any propane gas dispenser,
1.5 m from any natural gas dispenser,
6 m horizontally from any fixed source of ignition,
6 m horizontally from any liquefied petroleum gas cylinder or storage tank,
3 m from any building openings, other than those that serve as shelter for operating personnel and in which electrical installations conform to , and
6 m from any manhole or sewer opening (see ).

sentence.text: Fixed dispensers for Class II or IIIA liquids are permitted to be installed inside a building when

clause.text: the building is not open to the public,
the dispensers are located on the first storey,
drainage is provided, and
ventilation is provided in conformance with and with the requirements for storage garages in Subsection 6.3.1. of Division B of the .

sentence.text: The location of dispensers of Class I liquids within a building shall conform to Subsection 3.3.5. of Division B of the .
Fixed dispensers shall be protected against collision damage by

clause.text: a concrete island not less than 100 mm high, or
posts or guardrails.

sentence.text: Dispensers at marine fuel-dispensing stations shall be in a location that will prevent watercraft or aircraft impact, or other physical damage.
A device to shut off power to all dispensers and pumps shall be provided at a location not less than 6 m and not more than 30 m away from the dispensers and pumps. (See .)
The device required in shall be clearly identified and readily accessible to attendants and emergency responders. (See .)
Steel shut-off valves shall be provided at connecting outlets on aboveground storage tanks.

Except as provided in and and in addition to the device required by , an emergency shut-off switch to simultaneously stop the flow of fuel at all dispensers at self-service outlets shall be located at the central control console described in so that it is readily accessible to the attendant.
At card- or key-activated self-service outlets, the emergency shut-off switch required in shall be readily accessible to the customer. (See .)
Reset capability for emergency shut-off switches required by shall be restricted to manual operations.
At marine fuel-dispensing stations, a readily accessible valve shall be provided in each pipeline at or within 7.5 m of the pier to shut off the supply from shore.
Delivery hose shall conform to
Except as permitted in , hose through which flammable liquids or combustible liquids are dispensed at a fuel-dispensing station shall be restricted to a maximum extended length of 4.5 m.
Where a retracting mechanism is used, a maximum extended length of 6 m shall be permitted.
At marine fuel-dispensing stations or at card- or key-activated dispensers, the length of extended hose is permitted to exceed the values in .
Every hose nozzle valve through which a Class I or II liquid is dispensed by a motorized dispenser into a vehicle tank shall

clause.text: be automatic closing, as required in , and
conform to

sentence.text: Except as provided in , a hose nozzle valve shall be constructed so that the valve

clause.text: can be kept open only by the continuous application of manual pressure, or
is equipped with a hold-open device that is an integral part of the nozzle and that will

subclause.text: allow automatic dispensing,
automatically shut off when the vehicle tank is filled, and
shut off if the nozzle is dropped or falls from the fill pipe.

sentence.text: A hose nozzle valve at a marine fuel-dispensing station shall be of the type without a hold-open device, in conformance with .
When a hose nozzle valve with a hold-open device is used at an attended self-service outlet, a break-away coupling conforming to shall be provided.

When the flow of liquid can be stopped other than by the hose nozzle valve, a hose nozzle valve with a hold-open device is permitted to be used only if it is provided with a device that will automatically close the hose nozzle valve upon a drop of pressure in the dispensing hose.

This Subsection shall apply to systems for dispensing flammable liquids or combustible liquids where such liquids are transferred from bulk storage to individual or multiple dispensers by pumps located elsewhere than at the dispensers.
Pumps, including associated control equipment, shall be designed so that the system will not be subject to pressures above the design working pressure.
Pumps shall be securely anchored and protected against damage from vehicles.
An emergency valve conforming to shall be installed in the supply line so that the shear point of the valve is at a level not higher than the base of the dispenser nor more than 25 mm below it.
The emergency valve required in shall be maintained in operating condition and serviced at intervals not greater than 12 months.
Pumps installed aboveground and outside buildings shall be located not less than

clause.text: 3 m from any property line, and
1.5 m from any building opening.

sentence.text: When an outside pump location is impractical, pumps are permitted to be installed inside buildings or in pits as provided in
Except as permitted in , tanks and pumps not integral with the dispenser at marine fuel-dispensing stations shall be located on the shore or on a pier of the solid-fill type.
Where shore locations would result in excessively long supply lines to the dispenser, storage tanks are permitted to be installed on a pier, provided that

clause.text: the applicable portions of relating to spacing, secondary containment and piping are complied with, and
the quantity stored does not exceed 5 000 L aggregate capacity.

sentence.text: No storage tank at a marine fuel-dispensing station shall be located closer than 4.5 m horizontally from the normal annual high-water mark.
Storage tanks located on shore and supplying marine fuel-dispensing stations are permitted to be located aboveground where rock or a high water table make underground tanks impracticable.

Where storage tanks at a marine fuel-dispensing station are elevated above the dispenser, an automatically operated valve that is designed to open only when the dispenser is being operated, so as to prevent gravity draining of the tank in the event of a rupture of the supply line to the dispenser, shall be provided at the storage tank outlet, positioned adjacent to and outside the valve specified in
